data.name: Aborted_clients
data.type: number of aborted client connections. this can be due to the client not calling mysql_close() before exiting, the client sleeping without issuing a request to the server for more seconds than specified by

data.name: Aborted_connects
data.type: number of failed server connection attempts. this can be due to a client using an incorrect password, a client not having privileges to connect to a database, a connection packet not containing the correct information, or if it takes more than

data.name: Acl_column_grants
data.type: number of column permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Acl_database_grants
data.type: number of database permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Acl_function_grants
data.type: number of function permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Acl_procedure_grants
data.type: number of procedure permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Acl_proxy_users
data.type: number of proxy permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Acl_role_grants
data.type: number of role permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Acl_table_grants
data.type: number of table permissions granted (rows in the

data.name: Busy_time
data.type: cumulative time in seconds of activity on connections.

data.name: Bytes_received
data.type: total bytes received from all clients.

data.name: Bytes_sent
data.type: total bytes sent to all clients.

data.name: Com_admin_commands
data.type: number of admin commands executed. these include table dumps, change users, binary log dumps, shutdowns, pings and debugs.

data.name: Com_assign_to_keycache
data.type: number of assign to keycache commands executed.

data.name: Com_empty_query
data.type: number of queries to the server that do not produce sql queries. an sql query simply returning no results does not increment

data.name: Com_xa_recover
data.type: number of xa recover statements executed.

data.name: Com_xa_rollback
data.type: number of xa statements rolled back.

data.name: Connection_errors_accept
data.type: number of errors that occurred during calls to accept() on the listening port.

data.name: Connection_errors_internal
data.type: number of refused connections due to internal server errors, for example out of memory errors, or failed thread starts.

data.name: Connection_errors_max_connections
data.type: number of refused connections due to the

data.name: Connection_errors_peer_address
data.type: number of errors while searching for the connecting client ip address.

data.name: Connection_errors_select
data.type: number of errors during calls to select() or poll() on the listening port. the client would not necessarily have been rejected in these cases.

data.name: Connection_errors_tcpwrap
data.type: number of connections the libwrap library refused.

data.name: Connections
data.type: number of connection attempts (both successful and unsuccessful)

data.name: Created_tmp_disk_tables
data.type: number of on-disk temporary tables created.

data.name: Created_tmp_files
data.type: number of in-memory temporary tables created.

data.name: Delayed_errors
data.type: number of errors which occurred while doing

data.name: Empty_queries
data.type: number of queries returning no results. note this is not the same as

data.name: Executed_events
data.type: number of times events created with

data.name: Executed_triggers
data.type: number of times triggers created with

data.name: Feature_custom_aggregate_functions
data.type: number of queries which make use of

data.name: Feature_delay_key_write
data.type: number of tables opened that are using

data.name: Feature_gis
data.type: number of times a table with a any of the

data.name: Feature_invisible_columns
data.type: number of invisible columns in all opened tables.

data.name: Feature_json
data.type: number of times json functionality has been used, such as one of the

data.name: Feature_subquery
data.type: number of subqueries (excluding subqueries in the from clause) used.

data.name: Feature_timezone
data.type: number of times an explicit timezone (excluding

data.name: Handler_delete
data.type: number of times rows have been deleted from tables. differs from

data.name: Handler_discover
data.type: discovery is when the server asks the ndbcluster storage engine if it knows about a table with a given name. handler_discover indicates the number of times that tables have been discovered in this way.

data.name: Handler_external_lock
data.type: incremented for each call to the external_lock() function, which generally occurs at the beginning and end of access to a table instance.

data.name: Handler_icp_attempts
data.type: number of times pushed index condition was checked. the smaller the ratio of handler_icp_attempts to

data.name: Handler_icp_match
data.type: number of times pushed index condition was matched. the smaller the ratio of

data.name: Handler_mrr_init
data.type: counts how many mrr (multi-range read) scans were performed. see

data.name: Handler_mrr_key_refills
data.type: number of times key buffer was refilled (not counting the initial fill). a non-zero value indicates there wasn't enough memory to do key sort-and-sweep passes in one go.  see

data.name: Handler_mrr_rowid_refills
data.type: number of times rowid buffer was refilled (not counting the initial fill). a non-zero value indicates there wasn't enough memory to do rowid sort-and-sweep passes in one go. see

data.name: Handler_read_first
data.type: number of requests to read the first row from an index. a high value indicates many full index scans, e.g.

data.name: Handler_read_key
data.type: number of row read requests based on an index value. a high value indicates indexes are regularly being used, which is usually positive.

data.name: Handler_read_last
data.type: number of requests to read the last row from an index.

data.name: Handler_read_next
data.type: number of requests to read the next row from an index (in order). increments when doing an index scan or querying an index column with a range constraint.

data.name: Handler_read_prev
data.type: number of requests to read the previous row from an index (in order). mostly used with

data.name: Handler_read_retry
data.type: number of read retrys triggered by semi_consistent_read (innodb feature).

data.name: Handler_read_rnd
data.type: number of requests to read a row based on its position. if this value is high, you may not be using joins that don't use indexes properly, or be doing many full table scans.

data.name: Handler_read_rnd_deleted
data.type: number of requests to delete a row based on its position.

data.name: Handler_read_rnd_next
data.type: number of requests to read the next row. a large number of these may indicate many table scans and improperly used indexes.

data.name: Handler_rollback
data.type: number of transaction rollback requests given to a storage engine. differs from

data.name: Handler_savepoint
data.type: number of transaction savepoint creation requests. differs from

data.name: Handler_savepoint_rollback
data.type: number of requests to rollback to a transaction

data.name: Handler_tmp_delete
data.type: number of requests to delete a row in a temporary table.

data.name: Handler_tmp_update
data.type: number of requests to update a row to a temporary table.

data.name: Handler_tmp_write
data.type: number of requests to write a row to a temporary table.

data.name: Handler_update
data.type: number of requests to update a row in a table. since

data.name: Handler_write
data.type: number of requests to write a row to a table. since

data.name: Key_blocks_not_flushed
data.type: number of key cache blocks which have been modified but not flushed to disk.

data.name: Key_blocks_unused
data.type: number of unused key cache blocks.

data.name: Key_blocks_used
data.type: max number of key cache blocks which have been used simultaneously.

data.name: Key_blocks_warm
data.type: number of key cache blocks in the warm list.

data.name: Key_read_requests
data.type: number of key cache block read requests. see

data.name: Key_reads
data.type: number of physical index block reads. see

data.name: Key_write_requests
data.type: number of requests to write a block to the key cache.

data.name: Key_writes
data.type: number of key cache block write requests

data.name: Last_query_cost
data.type: the most recent query optimizer query cost calculation. can not be calculated for complex queries, such as subqueries or union. it will be set to 0 for complex queries.

data.name: Maria_*
data.type: when the maria storage engine was renamed aria, the maria variables existing at the time were renamed at the same time. see

data.name: Max_statement_time_exceeded
data.type: number of queries that exceeded the execution time specified by

data.name: Max_used_connections
data.type: max number of connections ever open at the same time.

data.name: Memory_used
data.type: global or per-connection memory usage, in bytes.

data.name: Open_files
data.type: number of regular files currently opened by the server. does not include sockets or pipes, or storage engines using internal functions.

data.name: Open_streams
data.type: number of currently opened streams, usually log files.

data.name: Open_tables
data.type: number of currently opened tables, excluding temporary tables.

data.name: Opened_files
data.type: number of files the server has opened.

data.name: Opened_table_definitions
data.type: number of .frm files that have been cached.

data.name: Opened_tables
data.type: number of tables the server has opened.

data.name: Opened_views
data.type: number of views the server has opened.

data.name: Performance_schema_accounts_lost
data.type: number of times a row could not be added to the performance schema accounts table due to it being full.

data.name: Performance_schema_cond_classes_lost
data.type: number of condition instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_cond_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances a condition object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_file_classes_lost
data.type: number of file instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_file_handles_lost
data.type: number of instances a file object could not be opened.

data.name: Performance_schema_file_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances a file object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_hosts_lost
data.type: number of times a row could not be added to the performance schema hosts table due to it being full.

data.name: Performance_schema_locker_lost
data.type: number of events not recorded, due to either being recursive, or having a deeper nested events stack than the implementation limit.

data.name: Performance_schema_mutex_classes_lost
data.type: number of mutual exclusion instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_mutex_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances a mutual exclusion object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_rwlock_classes_lost
data.type: number of read/write lock instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_rwlock_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances a read/write lock object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_socket_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances a socket object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_stage_classes_lost
data.type: number of stage event instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_statement_classes_lost
data.type: number of statement instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_table_handles_lost
data.type: number of instances a table object could not be opened.

data.name: Performance_schema_table_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances a table object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_thread_classes_lost
data.type: number of thread instruments that could not be loaded.

data.name: Performance_schema_thread_instances_lost
data.type: number of instances thread object could not be created.

data.name: Performance_schema_users_lost
data.type: number of times a row could not be added to the performance schema users table due to it being full.

data.name: Qcache_hits
data.type: number of requests served by the

data.name: Qcache_inserts
data.type: number of queries ever cached in the

data.name: Qcache_lowmem_prunes
data.type: number of pruning operations performed to remove old results to make space for new results in the

data.name: Qcache_not_cached
data.type: number of queries that are uncacheable by the

data.name: Qcache_queries_in_cache
data.type: number of queries currently cached by the

data.name: Qcache_total_blocks
data.type: number of blocks used by the

data.name: Queries
data.type: number of statements executed by the server, excluding com_ping and com_statistics. differs from

data.name: Questions
data.type: number of statements executed by the server, excluding com_ping, com_statistics, com_stmt_prepare, com_stmt_close, and com_stmt_reset statements. differs from

data.name: Rows_read
data.type: number of requests to read a row (excluding temporary tables).

data.name: Rows_tmp_read
data.type: number of requests to read a row in a temporary table.

data.name: Select_full_join
data.type: number of joins which did not use an index. if not zero, you may need to check table indexes.

data.name: Select_full_range_join
data.type: number of joins which used a range search of the first table.

data.name: Select_range
data.type: number of joins which used a range on the first table.

data.name: Select_range_check
data.type: number of joins without keys that check for key usage after each row. if not zero, you may need to check table indexes.

data.name: Select_scan
data.type: number of joins which used a full scan of the first table.

data.name: Slow_launch_threads
data.type: number of threads which took longer than

data.name: Slow_queries
data.type: number of queries which took longer than

data.name: Sort_merge_passes
data.type: number of merge passes performed by the sort algorithm. if too high, you may need to look at improving your query indexes, or increasing the

data.name: Sort_priority_queue_sorts
data.type: the number of times that sorting was done through a priority queue. (the total number of times sorting was done is a sum

data.name: Sort_range
data.type: number of sorts which used a range.

data.name: Sort_scan
data.type: number of sorts which used a full table scan.

data.name: Syncs
data.type: number of times my_sync() has been called, or the number of times the server has had to force data to disk. covers the

data.name: Table_locks_immediate
data.type: number of table locks which were completed immediately.

data.name: Table_locks_waited
data.type: number of table locks which had to wait. indicates table lock contention.

data.name: Table_open_cache_active_instances
data.type: number of active instances for open tables cache lookups.

data.name: Table_open_cache_hits
data.type: number of hits for open tables cache lookups.

data.name: Table_open_cache_misses
data.type: number of misses for open tables cache lookups.

data.name: Table_open_cache_overflows
data.type: number of overflows for open tables cache lookups.

data.name: Tc_log_max_pages_used
data.type: max number of pages used by the transaction coordinator recovery log.

data.name: Tc_log_page_size
data.type: page size of the transaction coordinator recovery log.

data.name: Tc_log_page_waits
data.type: number of times a two-phase commit was forced to wait for a free transaction coordinator recovery log page.

data.name: Threads_cached
data.type: number of threads cached in the thread cache. will be zero if the thread pool is in use (see

data.name: Threads_created
data.type: number of threads created to respond to client connections. if too large, look at increasing

data.name: Threads_running
data.type: number of threads that are actively running, not sleeping. until

data.name: Update_scan
data.type: number of updates that required a full table scan.

data.name: Uptime
data.type: number of seconds the server has been running.

data.name: Uptime_since_flush_status
data.type: number of seconds since the last
